responses.rationale: The segment describes costs, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a factual infection event.
The segment describes the intensification of an outbreak and past events.
The segment reports a factual confirmation of positive tests.

Describes preparedness and implemented measures ('prepared for situations like this', 'robust plans in place', 'now executing', 'heightening biosecurity measures', 'placing additional restrictions', 'continuing our practice of testing') without active reassurance.
The segment reports historical case numbers.
The segment states a factual characteristic (rarity) of cross-transmission, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the mechanism of infection.
The segment describes how infection can happen.
The segment describes how cross infection usually occurs.
The segment describes the range of illness severity.
The segment reports a past case.
Describes a safeguard/advice ('poultry and eggs should be cooked') to 'offset the risk' without active reassurance.
The segment describes concerns about non-health-related reasons.
The segment states facts about production and exports.
The segment reports a past confirmation.
Describes a safeguard/advice ('properly prepared and cooked poultry and eggs... kills bacteria and viruses') without active reassurance.
Describes implemented measures ('heightening biosecurity measures', 'placing additional restrictions', 'continuing our practice of testing') to 'mitigate the spread' without active reassurance.
The segment describes culling methods.
The segment describes culling methods and carcass disposal.
The segment quotes an opinion about humaneness.
The segment reports a past discovery and destruction event.
The segment reports a past confirmation.
The segment reports historical information about the virus.
Describes an implemented measure/capability ('ramping up biosecurity measures') without active reassurance.
The segment states a factual consequence (high mortality).
The segment reports a past event and cost.
The segment reports a factual detection.
Describes implemented measures/actions ('birds... will be depopulated', 'depopulation is complete') to 'prevent the spread' without active reassurance.
The segment reports a refusal to disclose information.
The segment reports awaiting results of a potential case.
The segment reports a positive test.
The segment reports a factual detection (includes technical term 'highly pathogenic').
The segment reports details about the detected flock.
Describes a safeguard/advice ('proper handling and cooking... kills bacteria and viruses') without active reassurance.
Describes ongoing measures/capability ('working jointly on additional surveillance and testing') without active reassurance.
The segment reports the sequence of discoveries.
The segment reports locations of cases factually.
The segment reports a past action (euthanization) factually.
The segment reports a past action (euthanization) and historical context factually.
The segment reports a belief about the source of spread.
Describes advice/guidance ('urged Americans... to review their biosecurity activities and prevent contact') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
The segment quotes an opinion about human infection rarity, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes an ongoing activity/capability ('had been monitoring people') without active reassurance.
